title: Why does Kha'Zix get snared if he leaps over a caitlyn trap.

replies.body: Caitlyn's traps are both spring-loaded _and_ have a joint heat- and motion-detecting laser hidden inside the cupcake, which is capable of detecting airborne organisms up to 50 feet into the air. The second something activates the sensor, the trap launches into the air to grab it.

But they could have easily made exceptions where Kha is invulnerable to Cait's trap if he's mid-leap, but they didn't.

That would create miles of spaghetticode! 

So much issues! Simply making him immune to traps would be problematic, because he'd still trigger them! And triggering them without getting CCed would still be sad and without being marked sounds next to impossible. If he has to be able to 'leap' over them he'd need to be untagetable while doing so, but than how to code he is still vulnerable to targeted abilities???

And even IF we could fix this easily by making Caits trap an exception... what about Satan shrooms? and Morgana pools? and Jinx Traps? What about Tristanas Jump and Aurelions Flight and why does Anivia trigger them at all? and... and... and...

So... just NO! Let's wait a few years... if the game still exists we might have a working Z-Axis after a major game relaunch with a new engine, code and balance made from scratch. Because something like this we'd need to accomplish such a massive Change.

Spaghetti code can be easily avoided if the game isn't programmed by monkeys. Simply do an additional check for "isInMidAir" variable and it's done. Really not that hard, not sure why you make such a huge issue out of it.

Sure once finished it's easy to work with such an variable (kinda.. we know the fun features of League code...), but finishing it IS the problem! It's not just one thing to change - it has to interact with tons of abilities with tons of Champions. 

Besides that IF we start applying Z-Logic on a non Z system, things will get outof controll quite fast! Simply because players expect some consistence! When Kha jumps over traps, why can Yasuo W Corki Qs? And what about flying Champions? 

Much ventured, nothing gained. If we get Z, great! I welcome it! But until then let's just stick with current system.

You've got to go into each ability and pick *when* in the ability you set the "isInMidAir" flag is set. Is it frame 1? Is it frame 5? When does the target *actually* get into Mid Air?

You've then got to go into every other ability and set a "canHitMidAir" flag. Does a Brand Pillar extend high enough? A Karthus wall?


Then you've got to add additional status check every time the two come into contact.

Now you've got to go fix the existing spaghetti code for how that ability displayed when it collided with enemy champions, because the idea of going *over* a spell didn't exist 7 years ago when it was made.

***Finally*** (and most critically) you've got to rebalance every champion for this change to their power budget. Kha'zix losses some damage because of the new outplay potential of his jump, Yasuo gains more damage because if how much of his kit is avoidable, etc.

-----

There's no reason to think it's as easy as adding a flag. There's a lot of other steps that would have to happen in addition to that flag, plus *would Riot even want to?*

> You've got to go into each ability and pick when in the ability you set the "isInMidAir" flag is set. Is it frame 1? Is it frame 5? When does the target actually get into Mid Air?

When there is a check if the model collided with the trap/ability or not. That is already in place, isn't it?

> You've then got to go into every other ability and set a "canHitMidAir" flag. Does a Brand Pillar extend high enough? A Karthus wall?

You can always restrict it to traps for now.

> Now you've got to go fix the existing spaghetti code for how that ability displayed when it collided with enemy champions, because the idea of going over a spell didn't exist 7 years ago when it was made.

You don't need to alter anything for this. I seriously hope jumping isn't animated individually for every item on the Rift.

> Finally (and most critically) you've got to rebalance every champion for this change to their power budget. Kha'zix losses some damage because of the new outplay potential of his jump, Yasuo gains more damage because if how much of his kit is avoidable, etc.

Again, no need. Jumping over a trap isn't really some game-breaking outplay mechanic.

> plus would Riot even want to?

THIS is the only reason why it isn't implemented yet. Not technical difficulties.

> [{quoted}](name=duckarp,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OLBVbAFm,comment-id=000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-02-27T14:52:54.427+0000)
>
> When there is a check if the model collided with the trap/ability or not. That is already in place, isn't it?

The collision check exists, but not setting the flag on the "jumping" champion. You've got to decide when to turn that flag on and off.

> You can always restrict it to traps for now.

That's a slippery slope and you know it. If you implement it for traps people will want it for other abilities.

Ultimately this idea boils down to "Should Riot arbitrarily make some abilities ignore other abilities based on how an animator decided to draw them?" There was *no* consideration for this in *any* art assets being made, so it seems clear the answer should be a big fat "no". 

Kha'Zix's jump could just as easily hug the ground, and Caitlyn's trap could just as easily leap into the air when something passes over it.

> Spaghetti code can be easily avoided if the game isn't programmed by monkeys. Simply do an additional check for "isInMidAir" variable and it's done. Really not that hard, not sure why you make such a huge issue out of it.

Yup. But since the game HAS been programmed by monkeys, you would have to start again from scratch to do something clean.

Y axis exists (btw Y axis is respnsible for up-down movement, Z-axis is responsible for depth, unless of course Rito devs are masochists and reverted the axis just cause). Ziggs ult for example can't be blocked by yasuo's windwall because its above it, but it can be blocked if the wall is put in front of ziggs. But Kha and basically all leap mobility spells aren't "leaps" you don't make use of the Y axis they just slide across the x-z axis. That's why Kha gets hit by cait traps, zac's leap can be cancelled mid air, etc. But remember it's just a theory. A league of Legends theory. Thanks for reading.

If Riot wants to fix it the old fashion way, they can make it so that jumping champs receive a buff while jumping that makes them ignore {{champion:51}} traps or {{champion:202}} traps. The same logic could be applied to Tristana's jump in a lot of scenario's.  

Why does Tristana' get pulled by Blitzcrank if she's mid-way through the air and he hit the origin point?

I think it's just better to leave jumps/dashes/blinks as consistent.

Better question, why do things that are snared by stuff that should hold them to the ground, get to keep their forward momentum during a dash when hit mid-dash, then use up the snare timer while in transit?

It doesn't work like that in real life, and if Riot is already worried about mobility creep, it would be a logical, and simple way of reducing it.

League doesn't have any systems for simulating changes in height, so jumps like Kha's and Tristana's are coded as dashes rather than blinks. The only exception, Poppy's ult making things untargetable, is very new in comparison and in her case it's meant to simulate them being thrown into the sky much higher than those jumps. It's archaic and lame, but those abilities take a dash's price out of the kit's power budget as opposed to that of a blink.
Shyvana's ult got changed to make it unstoppable, but she definitely paid for it.
